intro: Paraixeris strigosa, commonly known as the rough paraixeris, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. Paraixeris strigosa produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and are followed by fluffy, seed-filled capsules.
